body_content.explanation: to use a scarifier (= a tool with sharp points) to break up and remove unwanted grass or plants that are covering the surface of a lawn (= an area of grass):
examples: It is important to scarify regularly to avoid a mossy and spongy lawn.
When is the best time to scarify your lawn?

body_content.explanation: to use a scarifier (= a machine with sharp points) to break up the surface of the ground or a road:
examples: The work will include scarifying the asphalt to improve the road surface.

body_content.explanation: to make small cuts in someone's skin, especially for cultural reasons:
examples: The boy was scarified, but every effort was made to reduce his suffering to the minimum.
It would be very shocking if a supermodel decided to scarify her skin in the name of art.

body_content.explanation: to break into the surface of the outer part of a seed, either by cutting it or using chemicals, in order to help it to germinate (= start to grow):
examples: Once canna seeds have been scarified, they are easy to grow.
Seeds were scarified prior to sowing or later during incubation.

body_content.explanation: to express strong disapproval of someone, especially in an unpleasant or cruel way:
examples: He scarified our leading politicians, seizing upon their vulnerable points with a destructive analysis that left them bereft of merit or morality.
His scarifying essays were capable of destroying literary reputations.
